data.text:
Education is a fundamental human right for every woman, man & child.

Friday is #EducationDay. https://t.co/jVynpiRQDS via @UNESCO https://t.co/6TBbEz42ka

Happy #LunarNewYear!

Order your @unstamps for the Chinese Lunar Year of the Rat here: https://t.co/PIPVzRwX6b https://t.co/PEUaBaj0hc

Education is a human right and key to development & peace - yet globally 258 million children & youth are not in school.

More on Friday's #EducationDay. https://t.co/jVynpiRQDS https://t.co/0yWm4z6wyL

NEWS: @WHO emergency committee decides threat posed by #coronavirus not yet a global public health emergency; sets up team to investigate the outbreak, enhance surveillance & reinforce containment measures. https://t.co/RRZEs3Gt4i

"Our planet will not be destroyed by climate change. Our ability to live on the planet will be destroyed.  

We know what to do to change course. The good news is that people are mobilized."

@antonioguterres calls for #ClimateAction at #wef20 in Davos. 
https://t.co/bV3hcvW3v3 https://t.co/ihpBbPcUFe
.@CIJ_ICJ unanimously rules that Myanmar must take steps to protect its minority Rohingya population from genocide. https://t.co/7HjJorXEy6

From the climate emergency to increasing inequality, worldwide trends are having a profound impact on the needs of the most vulnerable.

@UNOCHA explains how emerging global challenges will shape the future of humanitarian action: https://t.co/fzwGdMIPOK https://t.co/pKqAq7ZsNp

The world needs environmental champions more than ever. 

The UN's highest environmental award recognizes the contributions of outstanding heroes who've had a positive impact on the planet.

Nominate your #EarthChamps today! https://t.co/7sWfDVrLZy

Young people who were once at risk of being recruited by extremist groups are now at the forefront of #SilencingtheGuns initiatives in Africa. 

More in the latest issue of @africarenewal: https://t.co/8rCOmBBRwG https://t.co/OzFKPygh4d

The Decade of Action for the #GlobalGoals is underway!

See how the UN system is supporting the world's "to-do" list for a better & more sustainable future for all in this @Twitter moment. https://t.co/lYzFfPhtf4
Update: @WHO to reconvene emergency committee on Thursday to further discuss spread of #coronavirus & possibility of declaring public health emergency. https://t.co/Q292cDkPUO

Education is essential for helping people develop their talents & realize their
potential. It's also a powerful catalyst for overcoming poverty, inequality & discrimination. 

More from @UNESCO ahead of Thursday's #EducationDay. https://t.co/wqKXPnOYH2 https://t.co/J1RP2JGYay

@UNDP is teaming up with partners at #GFMD12 to find solutions to harness the potential of migration in countries of origin & destination. https://t.co/bB0XAgMwny #GlobalGoals

 https://t.co/vfKywJBUuk

Geopolitical tensions.
The climate crisis.
Global mistrust.
The dark side of technology.

@antonioguterres identifies four big threats as he looks ahead to 2020 in #UNGA speech. https://t.co/Bnzl7OXP6K https://t.co/iohRgFruGu
Happening now: @antonioguterres looks ahead to 2020 in #UNGA speech. https://t.co/WhwXXmCYWf

Every day, @WFP delivers food, medicine & other relief items to vulnerable people living in some of the world’s most remote & challenging environments. https://t.co/1giHs2ooAf #ZeroHunger https://t.co/15L0DKv4EX

The UN flag, featuring a map of the world embraced by a wreath of olive branches, represents the hopes & dreams of people for peace & unity.  

@UNLibrary has more on the history of the UN flag 🇺🇳: https://t.co/RpNAZScWYx https://t.co/XrV0ed3QLs

A "use-it-&-toss-it" culture is leading to an abundance of trash, most of which will never be recycled. 

@UNDP has tips on how to create your own checklist for sustainable consumption: https://t.co/os4hiW5HMW #GlobalGoals https://t.co/2gcnalYJPA

On Wednesday, @WHO will convene Emergency Committee to determine if recent coronavirus outbreak constitutes a public health emergency & discuss next steps to control the spread of the illness.

More in this Q&A, including steps to take to stay healthy: https://t.co/IiaPWjzAwg https://t.co/ijTnNYljpG

NEWS: In historic case, UN Human Rights Committee finds that countries may not deport those whose lives may be a risk due to impacts of the climate crisis. https://t.co/eNz5SNBwdw #ClimateAction https://t.co/yf7gkfxlbm

The opportunities children have during their lifetimes often come down to who their parents are, where they grow up and what they own.

New #WorldSocialReport has practical ideas on how to end inequality: https://t.co/x2gxDmBCmb via @UNDESA https://t.co/CGK63hh7PS

14.6 million people living with HIV still do not have access to treatment. 

At #WEF20, @UNAIDS challenges leaders & the corporate sector to make health about people, not profit. https://t.co/rPxRqK4P6F

 https://t.co/WIS4VUbtMF

Almost half a billion people are working fewer hours than they would like or lack adequate access to work, new @ILO report shows. 

Lack of decent jobs + rising unemployment making it increasingly difficult for people to build better lives. 

https://t.co/dNT43dwCOj

“Early marriage has a negative effect on girls & their health. The girl loses her opportunity to fulfill her dreams. But it is getting better here."

In Lebanon, @UNOCHA is helping to prevent & respond to gender-based violence: https://t.co/otDbkXAFuS https://t.co/ceCCr7wLXg

The world is approaching a major health milestone -- 2 billion mosquito nets delivered to vulnerable families.
Around the 🌎, partnerships are saving millions of lives & helping to #EndMalaria. https://t.co/DKcf4H8Q6R via @UNFoundation https://t.co/sDzQtViNJG
New exhibit at UNHQ in NYC highlights what life was like inside the Lord’s Resistance Army & how former rebels are rebuilding their lives. https://t.co/IpNQJVwG4G https://t.co/06O0Fu65Iw
Australia is the “canary in the coal mine” of global heating, says @UNDP #SaveOurOcean Advocate @CodySimpson in new #ClimateAction blog post. https://t.co/ZEzpnkRPTd https://t.co/JyhqFVk7Bj

The first phase of the restoration of Al Nouri Mosque and its historic minaret in Mosul, Iraq is complete.

@UNESCO is reconstructing the mosque after it was destroyed by ISIL in 2017. https://t.co/23ENsqxMGJ https://t.co/iVfknuvaHR

Congratulations to the newest group of UN Security Officers! This all-female class graduated at UNHQ on Monday. 

More on their work. https://t.co/VNrT7lsQpo https://t.co/LTes7Uk3z6
NEWS: @WHO study shows that smokers who quit 4 weeks or more before surgery have a lower risk of complication and better results 6 months afterwards. https://t.co/Oh9v5JwybK https://t.co/8aktItPMaZ

📸: The "Knotted Gun" sculpture is an inspirational symbol of non-violence. 

It is just one of the many pieces of art depicting peace found at UNHQ in NYC. https://t.co/0dhYU4xnS6 https://t.co/CQ7YucDv05

The world's poorest children, particularly young girls, continue to face serious obstacles that prevent them from accessing quality education. 

Exclusion from education is a key driver of poverty & the global learning crisis, says @UNICEF. https://t.co/5zSWMDodPC #ForEveryChild https://t.co/6q6SOpOt6A

Halima's life was forever changed when terrorists forced her to join Boko Haram.
See how @UNCERF helps people like Halima & communities around the world regain their dignity & a better way of life. https://t.co/AYiOGGx8Yw #InvestinHumanity https://t.co/DStLf3nlSU

We can all stand up against racial prejudice & intolerant attitudes. 

Be a human rights champion & #FightRacism on Monday's #MartinLutherKing Day & every day: https://t.co/siDRqxkzEm #MLKDay https://t.co/GaDy90KIHZ
Starts on Monday at @UNGeneva: Committee on the Rights of the Child, 83rd Session. Details: https://t.co/bXumOmqHOX https://t.co/YI6r9jEvbh

Happening this week:  #SDGLive Zone at #WEF20, launch of World Social Report 2020 & much more.

Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cdxHx https://t.co/R9cgAKksXR

From historic floods to devastating droughts, African countries are bearing the brunt of the climate emergency.

Find out what #ClimateAction steps you can take to protect our planet, and all its people: https://t.co/099WaGGY5d https://t.co/mfeYEkAYwB
.@Refugees calls for increased funding and global support for Sudan’s displaced, their hosts & those who want to return home. https://t.co/d3WhxBzzlc

.@ILO is celebrating 100 years of promoting social justice around the world. 

A new "Dignity at Work" project documents the working life of people across the USA. Meet artist Henry Lipkis in this special report from  Louisiana. https://t.co/5i2GNzKDQ9

"We are here today to create an enabling international environment for Libyans themselves to come together to find solutions." -- @antonioguterres at international conference on Libya. https://t.co/ynLgasTXH4 https://t.co/wIRgAGeK2L

Every #CimateAction counts! Instead of driving, you could walk, use public transport or bike.

See how your everyday choices can help protect the planet and all its people. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/Vqe2UmO0oo

Economic growth in the coming year facing serious challenges due to:

↔️ Prolonged trade disputes
💸 High levels of debt
⚔️ Geopolitical tensions
🔥 Catastrophic climate events

Full details in new #WorldEconomyReport. https://t.co/ODBKe9wWrG https://t.co/Opl7PgRqTK

For the last two decades, the @globalcompact has called on business to uphold universal principles in the areas of human rights, labour, environment and anti-corruption.

#UnitingBusiness can help create a better world for all. https://t.co/TZfourh2dq https://t.co/lsuUGkuUs3

Happy birthday to our former Secretary-General Javier Pérez de Cuéllar, who turns 100 on Sunday! 

Get details on his career and achievements here: https://t.co/LtAQBTcW1A https://t.co/pr53afrV0U

The UN is seeking nominations for the 2020 #MandelaPrize.

For only the second time, the award will honour two individuals for their service to humanity. Details on the prize given in recognition of Madiba's extraordinary legacy. https://t.co/tkrfWWhCpn https://t.co/fIqPbM9KmD

The 5 warmest years for the world’s oceans were

5⃣ 2016
4⃣ 2015
3⃣ 2017
2⃣ 2018
1⃣ 2019

To address the climate emergency, countries must accelerate #ClimateAction. https://t.co/AuggCtoNQ2 via @UNFCCC https://t.co/IlX9I97RIJ

Human rights are for everyone!

From protecting free speech to tackling violence, @free_equal outlines steps countries should take to end discrimination against LGBTI people. https://t.co/i7VPUzCR0I #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/sKBDw3b7rB

Rising temperatures & extreme weather due to the climate crisis are putting World Heritage Sites at risk. 

@UNESCO has more on the need to safeguard humanity's shared cultural history. https://t.co/PeB2ZZmKq9 https://t.co/QmZFR2gt5h

Despite important gains, working women still face discriminatory laws & regulations.

See what reforms countries are making and where more progress is needed: https://t.co/jrKRVk5ejO via @WorldBank https://t.co/WsM4nFdYhP

Libya: Tens of thousands of children at risk amidst violence and chaos of unrelenting conflict, says @UNICEF, calling for a peace agreement for the sake of every child in the country. https://t.co/3jMINh6Mhy

On Friday, we honoured the 102 UN colleagues who lost their lives in the devastating #HaitiEarthquake, 10 years ago - the single greatest lost of life in our Organization's history. https://t.co/OEdqyoK2yT https://t.co/NCl79IXFJ1

The devastating environmental losses in the #AustralianBushfires highlight the important need to protect our world's biodiversity. 

Conservation expert @JohnEScanlon discusses this issue & more in our latest 🎧 podcast. https://t.co/w3kC0Euckp

We all have a role to play in achieving gender equality. 

Here are 7 tips for parents via @UN_Women https://t.co/IN3RJhmJq9 #GenerationEquality https://t.co/uLa1ZdC5XJ

A loss of this scale leaves permanent reminders & scars, on Haiti & on the UN. It binds us together & we will never forget.

-- @antonioguterres marking 10th anniversary of #HaitiEarthquake, which took the lives of 220k people, including 102 UN colleagues. https://t.co/bGR33muoXC https://t.co/CgVwQKlDAR

In South Sudan, 1 in 10 children die before their 5th birthday.
@UNOCHA says nearly 7.5 million people in the country will need humanitarian assistance or protection in the coming year. https://t.co/V0ep1nTTkG https://t.co/AVdGThtI4g

Schools should be a safe haven for children. Yet, for millions of students around the world, violence is an everyday lesson. 

See how YOU can help take action to #ENDViolence against children. https://t.co/B0fQ67MS7Y

Unverified & inaccurate information shared on social media can put public health at risk & erode trust in public institutions.

More on this and other urgent health challenges @WHO is working to address. https://t.co/nTn89R20zs

Sudan: Thousands of pregnant women displaced and in dire need of adequate reproductive health services due to violence & instability in the West Darfur region. 

@UNFPA is working to set-up health clinics & distribute emergency medical kits. https://t.co/37FPquTjLw

At #COP25 & the #ClimateAction Summit, businesses, cities & citizens demonstrated their commitment to addressing the climate emergency. 

More on their plans & the clear links between job creation, prosperity & climate action. https://t.co/m3N5Z7IPcw
Despite recent tensions in the Gulf, situation in Yemen remains stable, as leaders demonstrate restraint and avoid provocation, @OSE_Yemen tells Security Council. https://t.co/G5JwN6RZZl

Global economic growth hit a 10-year low in 2019, with only 2.3% growth last year.
High levels of debt, geopolitical tensions & catastrophic climate events further threaten economic prospects in 2020. https://t.co/ODBKe9wWrG #WorldEconomyReport https://t.co/ECpDzbbyJT

No country or community can solve the complex problems of our world alone.

As the UN turns 75, now's your chance to share your ideas & solutions on how we can build a better future together. https://t.co/xZylMfLi8z #UN75 https://t.co/tBUIjJTYoE

Mali: Full implementation of peace agreement only viable path for country's stabilization. Deteriorating security situation throughout the Sahel cause for concern, @UNPeacekeeping chief @Lacroix_UN tells Security Council. https://t.co/TudSVRBWsl

Civilians, including rebel groups & militias, hold more than 40 million small arms in Africa, hindering efforts to achieve a conflict-free continent.

More on @_AfricanUnion #SilencingTheGuns campaign for peace by 2020: https://t.co/BCrD3rL9ig via @AfricaRenewal https://t.co/PyZe3FHBgP

Philippines: UN supporting local response to #TaalVolcano.

Response teams in place amid fears of hazardous eruption putting hundreds of thousands of people at risk. https://t.co/HvNDorVfOh https://t.co/ClTuIOWtLJ

.@WMO confirms 2019 was the second warmest year on record.

Retreating ice, record sea levels, increasing ocean heat & acidification, and extreme weather, fueled by climate crisis, having major impacts on human health & the environment. #ClimateAction

https://t.co/zeOcxLGpn1

Salem left everything behind when he fled with his family to escape fighting in Yemen.

See how @WFP's cash assistance programme helps people like Salem take care of their basic needs with a renewed sense of hope. https://t.co/EOnqeGUOCR #ZeroHunger 

https://t.co/WayQdWPcej

2020 marks the 100th anniversary of the 19th Amendment in the United States, which gave women the right to vote.

Take a look at other historic women’s movements that shaped the lives & the rights of women & girls worldwide. via @UN_Women
https://t.co/JSjccxZIv6

Nearly 1,000 migrants have been returned to Libya in the first two weeks of 2020.

@UNMigration alarmed by sudden increase in departures and providing emergency assistance, including medical support. https://t.co/uPPuL3N5oS https://t.co/xVpPqTTB3m

It's our shared responsibility to safeguard humanity's cultural history.

More from @UNESCO on how you can help protect our common history through the World Heritage Volunteers Initiative. https://t.co/U5wN2ptWFK https://t.co/trllLyjd4Y

.@WHO working with officials in Thailand & China following confirmed case novel coronavirus.

Latest updates, including tips on how to stay healthy. https://t.co/9hbiq41Li4 https://t.co/mmnlvlFEkm

In response to #AustralianBushfire, @UNICEFAustralia is working with partners to provide affected children with back-to-school packages, and supporting them through the recovery & rehabilitation process. https://t.co/BfZucdWhBK

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

Yet racism is a problem in every country. 

Speak out and #FightRacism & intolerance every day, everywhere. https://t.co/QpwavXjVnW https://t.co/Q4Pupkk6n0
“Inclusion is key to our world," says @UN_PGA, as he outlines his priorities for the new year, including the #GlobalGoals & ensuring quality education. https://t.co/Dlmq8dSXiG

Regular and adequate levels of physical activity can help:

💪 Build strong bones & muscles
⚕️ Protect against chronic diseases & many cancers
👴👵 Support healthy ageing

More from @WHO on why we should all #BeActive: https://t.co/eFmx2k8HkM https://t.co/gq7gY782eK

Sustainable food & agricultural systems can help:

⬇️ Reduce the number of poor & hungry
⛈️ Combat the climate crisis
🌱 Preserve our natural resources

See how @FAO & partners work to promote sustainable food systems. #GlobalGoals https://t.co/46miC7O5sL
Syria: @UNICEF continues working to help the conflict's youngest victims amid violence, chaos, cold & humanitarian access restrictions. #ChildrenUnderAttack https://t.co/XJRrDq3IY9

Only 30% of the world’s scientific researchers are women. 

@UNESCO is working to help reduce the gender gap in science, technology, engineering & mathematics (STEM). https://t.co/Miv7K2nSsz https://t.co/hwz7hm6K6X

10 years ago, a devastating earthquake caused widespread damage & destruction in Haiti.

A decade on, @UNICEF is still helping Haitians on the long road toward recovery. https://t.co/LEaNTzT8iA

Forests
🌳 buffer impact of storms & floods
🌿 help address the climate crisis
🌲 provide shelter, jobs & security for forest-dependent populations.

See how @UNEP supports protection of forests to benefit all. #ClimateAction https://t.co/N2wW2KnxbP

https://t.co/0JLJEnL1xY

Children are the least responsible for climate change, yet they will bear the greatest burden of its impact.

More from @UNICEF on the urgent need for #ClimateAction: https://t.co/w2FhhwVd1v https://t.co/tP2S7O8ukr

Are you interested in working for the UN?

Here are some tips for job interviews from @UN_Careers:
☑️ Prepare stories about your accomplishments
☑️ Be ready to discuss your ability to learn from experience
☑️ Listen to questions carefully

More info: https://t.co/J6VgGEYRTJ https://t.co/tlOsB2spOU

1/3 of deaths from stroke, lung cancer & heart disease are due to air pollution - an equivalent effect to that of smoking.

More on the serious health effects of air pollution from @WHO: https://t.co/GaqicdSqpt https://t.co/PngAs9P2XQ

Zambia: Prolonged drought has left more than 2.3 million people at risk of severe food insecurity.

@UNOCHA warns that urgent funding is needed to help the most vulnerable. #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/DZNRvUIWL1

This new year, go for 'green' resolutions you can keep:

🍴 Say no to plastic cutlery
☕️ Bring your own coffee mug
🟢 Opt for plastic-free products
🛍 Carry your own reusable bag for shopping

More #ClimateAction ideas for 2020 from @UNEP: https://t.co/G7GSNdgXb1 https://t.co/m1gSHZe1JW

10 years ago we lost 102 friends & colleagues in the Haiti earthquake.

We remember them today & always: https://t.co/xJlBF5h9pV https://t.co/1NEZrRIhxd

2020 marks the 5th anniversary of the #GlobalGoals - the world's blueprint to achieve a better & more sustainable future for all.

From ending poverty to #ClimateAction, learn more about the 17 goals to transform our world 🌎 https://t.co/JK06bfAoYL https://t.co/dwIoZdmwP5

Ensuring inclusive quality education for all is one of the #GlobalGoals.

See if your country is on track to achieve this target by 2030: https://t.co/2Vve4NpFOx via @UNESCOstat https://t.co/uFS0KeU6hw

Today we remember our friends, colleagues and all those killed ten years ago in the Haiti earthquake.

We will never forget them. https://t.co/romY4vHQPw https://t.co/OB3587k0ur
As #AustralianBushfire continues to rage, @UNICEFAustralia is working with partners in the country to provide assistance, especially crucial support to children. https://t.co/BfZucdWhBK

When #CycloneIdai hit nine months ago, warnings broadcast on community radio stations helped protect lives & property.

Now, as Mozambique continues its recovery, @WFP has helped get some of those vital radio stations back on the air. 📻📡 https://t.co/diSmPBgCRF

Women's rights = human rights

Every day, women’s human rights defenders around the world brave threats for speaking up to end discrimination & violence against women. #StandUp4HumanRights via @UN_Women
https://t.co/zvSoHGPEH0

As the UN turns 75 this year, our latest UNComplicated podcast 🎧 shows how people around the world are taking part in the largest-ever global conversation on building the future we want. #UN75
https://t.co/KhrlUK1pQY
.@Refugees is honoured by @iocmedia for supporting refugees & host communities through sport & promoting values of the Olympics around the world. https://t.co/iRqJGek101
